p: Periodic fasting induced a significant weight loss in the overall population (−4.37 ± 2.42 kg, p < 0.001). In the non-diabetic subgroup, the mean changes were −4.31 ± 2.41 kg ( p < 0.001), in the T2DM subgroup −5.29 ± 2.55 kg ( p < 0.001). Half of the subjects (348, 49.9%) lost ≥5% of their body weight. Overall, the BMI decreased by −1.51 ± 0.82 kg/m 2 ( p < 0.001). In non-diabetic subjects, the BMI decreased by −1.50 ± 0.81 kg/m 2 ( p < 0.001), and in T2DM patients by −1.75 ± 0.85 kg/m 2 ( p < 0.001).
